description: 1965 Mustang 2+2 original K code Fast back.
This car has been garaged since 1999. Vehicle is 90% OEM. 10% NOS. All original K code drive line components
(Transmission, Top loader 4 speed,  9 inch ring 3.56 equalok rear, course spline axels, 10.5 clutch assembly intact and in good mechanical order).

289/271hp engine is out of car disassembled. Engine block, forged crankshaft, 3/8 nut connecting rods with wrist pins are good. Solid lifter camshaft and lifters worn from high mileage. All parts intact minus pistons (hairline cracks in 3 piston skirts) and OEM cast iron exhaust headers that had cracked flanges.
Running mixed parts 289/325hp windsor engine in car with some of the
K code
parts installed.
(Heads, Dual point centrifical distributor, Intake manifold. All OEM to 289/271 engine.)
New NOS triple core radiator and NOS fuel tank installed 2010/12. Original Autolite 4 barrel manual choke carburetor boxed needing a rebuild.
Vehicle body intact

, All glass good. Bumpers good, some wear on chrome finish. Some body repairs (Bondo) driver side door and quarter panel} Interior intact, Drivers seat mismatched due to broken seat frame. Dashboard blemish at radio knob mounting area. Previous owner mounted Ford Galaxie AM/FM radio. Original AM radio with other parts avalible with car. Emergency brake pull handle inoperative. Have Black OEM 1965 Mustang handle to replace it. Dashboard pad and glove box cracked and not serviceable removed from car. Steel wheel rims 14 by 6 inch 5 bolt standard Ford with good tires on car.

Under body of car has normal rust and deterioration typical of a northeastern daily driver. Some rust through at rear frame rails. Original drum brakes and single bowl master cylinder assembly on car. Dual exhaust system intact, needs relacement.
Electrical/charging system good. Some fuse panel corrosion in interior dash light circut.

The 1965 Ford Mustang is THE original ''Pony Car''. Conceived by automotive visionary and then Ford division president Lee Iacocca, the 1965 Mustang took the nation by storm when it debuted. Introduced on April 17, 1964 at the New York world's fair, the Mustang went on to sell over half a million units its first year out of the gate. Meant to be a sporty car for everyone, the Mustang could be optioned from plebeian commuter car all the way up to a 289 ''K code'' factory street racer. Based on a Ford Falcon chassis, and sharing many parts with other FoMoCo passenger cars, the Mustang was a winning combination that was the right car at the right time. This success caught GM and Chrysler corporation off guard, and the Mustang enjoyed two full years of owning the ''Pony Car'' market before GM could get the Camaro and Firebird into production. Now even as the pony car wars rage on today, it is only the Mustang that has been in continuous production for fifty three years, a testament to the legend that was created that first year in 1965. And here we have a fine example of what it was that made buyers from all different walks of life desire to own a piece of the Mustang story. This black beauty is simply gorgeous in its black on black appearance. Up front the dark paint is off set by the shiny chrome bumper and ''GT'' grille with built in amber fog lamps. The white stripe tires on chrome Mustang ''Rally'' wheels exemplify the style of the period. Out back it is all business, with dual exhaust tips exiting from a painted valance under the rear chrome bumper. Inside, this well equipped Mustang features the ''Pony'' interior decor, with embroidered Mustangs on the black vinyl bucket seats. The interior gauges have been replaced with custom sport comp units that add to the sporty flair and a custom center console was added to increase storage and driver comfort.. Under the hood is where the true magic happens, with a 289 V-8 playing a melodic exhaust note that is automotive nirvana. The power from this free revving sweetheart is sent rearward through a sweet shifting three speed automatic transmission with floor shift. This is one super nice, very original and period correct Mustang. If you desire to own your own piece of the legend, then stop in or email us at
[Email Dealer]
and put this pony in your stable today!!!

Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1965 Ford Mustang. We scour the country for vintage cars and trucks and we rarely come across one like this! You must see and drive this rare Mustang!
HISTORY

The Ford Mustang was brought out five months before the normal start of the 1965 production year. The early production versions are often referred to as "1964½ models" but all Mustangs were advertised, VIN coded and titled by Ford as 1965 models, though minor design updates for fall 1965 contribute to tracking 1964½ production data separately from 1965 data (see data below). with production beginning in Dearborn, Michigan on March 9, 1964; the new car was introduced to the public on April 17, 1964 at the New York World's Fair. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA

GIVEN THE NATURE OF THE VINTAGE VEHICLES WE SELL, THESE COMPONENTS CAN BE WORKING AT ONE MOMENT AND NOT WORKING AT ANOTHER MOMENT. IT IS COMMON THAT THESE COMPONENTS WILL NEED UPKEEP OR ATTENTION. IN ADDITION, MANY TIMES THESE VEHICLES SIT FOR LONG PERIODS OF TIME AND ONCE YOU BEGIN TO DRIVE THEM SEALS HARDEN AND GASKETS MAY BEGIN TO LEAK! CLASSIC CARS LEAK. PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU ARE COMFORTABLE WITH THIS BEFORE BUYING A VINTAGE AUTOMOBILE.  Please call a sales expert to get details on these systems 1-877-422-2940.
CLASSIC CAR RESTORATIONS:

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to “restore” a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Frame off restoration.
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).
Rotisserie restoration.

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).
Cosmetic or “driver quality” restoration.

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an “in the garage / amateur” restoration to a high dollar professional “concours” restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).
Factory or stock restoration.

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).
Custom restoration.

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as “customs” or “hot rods”. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is “pro-touring” or “restomod / restomods” which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2640.

1966 A Code Mustang Coupe - Believed to be a true factory GT with all correct parts that a factory GT would have. Dual exhaust wih factory hangers, A Code, Front disc brakes, close ratio steering box and fog lights. Motor was replaced at some point with a 289 2V but all other parts are correct. Original floors and all body panels in excellent condition. This is a two owner California car. The current owner has had the car for approx 25 years. Originally a wimbledon white with pony interior. San Jose built. 3.0 conventional axle. The car has one nice respray in a non original color. Panel fit is excellent ad the car runs and drives very nicely. Optioned with Power steering as well. Door plate intact which matches the stamping on the inner DS fender.

True 19641/2 Mustang Convertible 260 V-8, Auto, PS,PB,P Top,Console, 5 Style Steel Wheels, with Double Red Line Tires. Very nice white paint ,Blue interior, Beautiful Blue Canvas Top with Blue boot. Nice body and panel fit, pretty chrome. . Beautiful car you would be proud to own and drive.  $28,000.  Call 540-303-7701

Beautiful 1964 1/2 Red/Red Mustang Convertible.  Same owner for 19 years, only 4175 miles put on it, always garaged and covered.  Manufactured 6/29/64 in Dearborn,MI plant.  289 V8 automatic with power white top.  Originally manufactured 170 ci 6, a previous owner upgraded.  Looks great and runs great.

title: 1965 Ford Mustang A-Code With GT Trim Package

description: Beautiful 1965 Mustang Fastback with GT Trim, newly painted (2012?) original Arcadian Blue (per vin  info)  with  289 "A" Code Engine, 4 barrel carburetor, dual exhaust with the trumpet chrome tips, original GT wheels, 4-speed standard transmission, power steering, fog lights, perfect black leather interior, excellent condition, always garaged, non-smoker. I bought this car 5 years ago in North Carolina, where the car was originally delivered to, from an elderly man who had done the restoration.The owner said it had about 4 owners in and around the same town. I have North Carolina plate from 1965 - that came with the car. The Mustang only had 77,379 miles on it when I bought it - It hadn't been on the road since 1989 - probably restored about then. Lots of original on this car - floorboards etc - looks like it has had minor body work - it's really in great shape! Very clean and original underneath - most car guys (mechanics) comment on how clean it is when they get it up on the lift. Gas tank had been replaced before I got it. I had to replace original front windshield as I caught a rock on the highway.

I've owned 5 1965 Mustangs and this is the nicest one I have ever driven - the engine runs great. New tires, shocks, breaks etc...I've done oil changes every year but I've only done about 1,500 miles a year (85,213 current miles - I rounded up in case I drive it again before I sell it). Never seen rain or snow since I've owned - still garaged year round. The reason I'm selling it is I just don't get the chance to drive it enough. Serious buyers only $33,999.

California Mustang restored with Shelby features, high performance motor and custom stereo system. It has real solid original floors and good clean body. Completely repainted a smooth glossy bright white with the blue Shelby racing stripes. It's enhanced with the lower Shelby air dam valance, custom grill and Shelby style scooped hood with pins. Has 17 inch aluminum wheels with Hankook performance tires. The glass is tinted. New chrome bumpers, handles, mirrors, gas cap, taillights, 1/4 trim. New stainless around windows. Interior is completely custom and matches exterior. Bright white upholstery with blue inserts. Has unique one of a kind door panels, Shelby style gauge pod with Phantom tachometer and oil pressure gauges. Has seat belts front and back. Has a premium stereo system including Alpine amps, 12'' subwoofers and speakers. Its all proudly displayed in the trunk, stereo hidden in glovebox. The best part us under the hood- a performance built 289 with Trickflow aluminum heads and polished Edelbrock intake, Edelbrock 600 carb and MSD ignition. Dressed up with aluminum valve covers pulleys, bracket and chrome alternator. Has headers and Magnaflow mufflers. Aluminum radiator with electric fan keeps it cool. Wilwood front disc brakes. This is an early production ''1964 1/2'' D code car. Just restored in 2012, this car is ready for show and go!

Up for sale we have a 1965 Ford Mustang Coupe.  This car appears to feature a lot of originality.  It's a factory C code car and comes with Power Brakes, Power Steering, and Air condition.  In the paragraphs to follow we will give a brief description of the exterior, interior, and driveline of the Ford, but first we would like to tell you a little about us.

Smoky Mountain Traders is a classic car dealer in east Tennessee. We are family owned, operated, and own our entire inventory, no consignments, and only deal in muscle cars and vintage auto. You can count on us to have 70 to 80 cars at all times. We don't have a big show room that our customers would otherwise pay for. So, that's how we can sell for less than other dealers. To contact us for more information, pictures, or any questions call our office at (865)988-8088 or visit our SmokyMountainTraders website.

We will start off with the exterior of the Mustang.  When you walk around it the body panels appear to be factory with all the gaps being symmetrical, and the fit of the doors, hood, and trunk are great.  It's covered in the Arcadian Blue Paint that looks to be mostly original.  All the glass looks to be factory along with the window trim.  All the chrome is still very nice, but is showing some age.  To finish off the look it's sitting on a set of 14'' Styled Steel Wheels with Hankook Tires.

Next, we will look at the interior of the Coupe.  On the inside, it's also done in what appears to be the factory interior.  It has the blue crinkle vinyl with a front bench seat.  The seat covers are older and there's a small tear on the driver side.  Both door panels appear original and are in very good condition.  The headliner is done in the light blue and is also very nice for its age.  Looking at the dash it all appears stock, and the dash lights are working.  The AC is mounted under the dash and is also working.

Finally, we will look at the driveline of the Ford.  Under the hood it's been upgraded to a 302 Engine that's set up with a Ford Intake and AutoLite Carb.  It's dressed in stock style valve covers and breather.  The engine is mated to a C4 Trans and 8'' Rear End with a 2.80 Gear.  This Mustang has Power Brakes, Power Steering, and Air Condition.  The exhaust flow thru stock manifolds with the stock style exhaust.  When you look under this '65 it appears to be all original floors and frame, there's even still some factory over spray on the floors.

Chequered Flag is pleased to offer this 1965 Ford Mustang Convertible in Red with Black interior and Black top.  Original A-Code with factory 4 Barrel Carburetor 4-Speed Rally Pac and GT Trim (fog lights sports steel rims twin trumpet exhaust).  Fantastic body with good underside and trunk area.  Very good paint and superb interior.  Slight fading on the carpet but no rips or tears.  Very nice mechanically and a delight to drive. Comes with books and records going back to 1980.  Jack and spare included.  This is a great honest A-Code Mustang.  We don't see many this good anymore. Inspections encouraged. All sales AS-IS. When Ford introduced the Ford Mustang in 1964 an instant love affair with the American Pony Car was born. The Mustang was smaller, lighter, and more nimble that any American manufacturer had produced thus far. This coupled with its fresh design, the Ford Mustang became a must have among the American public. 1967 marked a pivotal year for the Mustang, as this was the first time since the first generation made its debut that vast changes were made to the Mustang. Making it larger and having many more engine options than before. It also eliminated some things that did not make sense. 1968 was just the same and by this point, Ford had found the next best thing and had very little for competition comparatively.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this beautiful 1968 Ford Mustang convertible.  It is dressed in diamond blue over a 2 tone blue interior.  The Mustang is powered by a 289 v8 paired with an automatic transmission.  The engine and surrounding area was restored and rebuilt by CD's Engine Service in 2013 and the car comes with receipt to show this.  The engine and under the hood was beautifully painted and shows very well.  The car rides on Hanook tires.  The car has power steering, power convertible top, car cover, spare tire, and center console.  The car was NSRA certified in 2016.  When it comes to cruising in a convertible a Mustang is hard to beat, especially one that fires up and drives like it should!
